Messages.Author: Anne van Leeuwen
Messages.Content: Dear students, Yesterday, we held a short session on the requirements of the final paper for this seminar. You will find the slides of my presentation in the materials for this week. Contrary to what was earlier communicated, the final deadline for the paper is 31 August 2024 at 23:59. The paper should be sent as pdf via email to a.van.leeuwen@tu-berlin.de I'm looking forward to receiving and reading your papers.  Regards, Anne

Messages.Author: Boris Heinz
Messages.Content: Good evening,   It is unfortunate but we need to cancel tomorrows seminar.  I apologise for the short notice and I look forward to discussing with you in the next sessions about the next topics and the presentations.  Best regards, Boris

Messages.Author: Boris Heinz
Messages.Content: Dear all, we are looking forward to the presentations tomorrow in our seminar.  Including the presentation from last week, which did not happen, we would have three presentations in total and we would use the entire seminar for these three presentations. The planned presentations for tomorrow are:  - Kanij Fatema on Greenhouse-gas emission targets - Marleen Kaymer on Triggering Climate Tipping Points, and - Maria Jose Loaiza on Climate Justice and Human rights. We look forward to it.  Kind regards, Boris

Messages.Author: Boris Heinz
Messages.Content: Dear all,  the message should not have mentioned "tomorrow" but Wednesday. Our next seminar takes place on Wednesday this week.  Sorry for the confusion.  Best regards, Boris

Messages.Author: Boris Heinz
Messages.Content: Dear students, it is very unfortunate, but we have to cancel our seminar tomorrow. I apologise for the short notice. Our next seminar will therefore take place on 5 June 2024. I look forward to it. Best regards, Boris

Messages.Author: Anne van Leeuwen
Messages.Content: Dear students, Please use the following google sheet to register for your article presentation: Registration form. You can choose an article from the list on the top, or make your own suggestion. When you choose an article from the list, please be sure to remove it from the top row, so it doesn't get presented more than once. All the articles can be found in the course material for the seminar on 17 April. Thank you! Kind regards, Anne van Leeuwen

Messages.Author: Boris Heinz
Messages.Content: Dear students, it is very unfortunate, but we have to cancel our seminar tomorrow. I apologise for the short notice. Our next seminar will therefore take place on 15 May 2024. I look forward to it. Best regards, Boris

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Date and location of the seminar

Messages.Author: Boris Heinz
Messages.Content: Dear all, there was some discussion about potentially changing the location of the seminar between campuses given conflicting schedules of some students. We have checked internally and unfortunately, it is not possible to change the room or the time of this seminar.  The date and location of the seminar stay the same. Best regards, Boris

Messages.Author: Boris Heinz
Messages.Content: Dear students,  For those of you who are coming to the seminar room tomorrow for the first time:   The seminar room is at TUB campus Mitte located at Ackerstr. 76, 13355 Berlin It is room 393 on the third floor You can reach the room easiest through entrance H (walk into the courtyard and then make a right) We look forward to the beginning of the seminar tomorrow. Best regards, Boris

Messages.Author: Boris Heinz
Messages.Content: Further to the description above.  Once you arrive on the third floor of the building, please make a right and you will see the door to the seminar room.

Messages.Author: Anna-Marleen Kaymer
Messages.Content: Hello Anne and everyone, I have an administrative question: How do I register for the final examination (in our case the presenation and the termpaper) in this course? It was not possible to register via "Moses". Are there different regulations for students from other universities like me who take the course as a BUA-module? I'm afraid to miss the registration deadline... I look forward to your reply! Best wishes, Marleen

Messages.Author: Anna-Marleen Kaymer
Messages.Content: Dear Anne, I have a general question on the division of the articles. In the google sheet, the articles „Tipping elements in the Earth’s climate system“, „Triggering Climate Tipping Points“ and „Climate Justice and human rights“ are divided in several parts. Would you mind explaining the background of that? Is it possible for one person to simply present the whole article? Furthermore, according to the sheet, three different people can present three different articles in one day, right? I’m sorry if this has already been answered and if I cause any confusion! Best wishes,  Marleen

Messages.Author: Boris Heinz
Messages.Content: Dear Marleen,  let me jump in before the long weekend begins.  To your first question: it is possible for one person to simply present the whole article. However, it can also be split for two/three persons, hence the several parts.  To your second question: this is correct, up to three students can present three different articles in one session. This would then mean that we have presentations only.  I hope this clarifies.  Best regards, Boris

Messages.Author: Maria Jose Loaiza Coronado
Messages.Content: Hello! I propose using this forum to comment on which article each one will choose for their presentation.

Messages.Author: Maria Jose Loaiza Coronado
Messages.Content: The article I want to work with is: Schapper, A. (2018). Climate justice and human rights. International Relations, 32(3), 275-295.

Messages.Author: Anne van Leeuwen
Messages.Content: Dear Maria, Thank you for the suggestion. Please see my message in the general forum with the link to the registration form, and register your presentation there. Many thanks and have a nice day! Best regards, Anne
